title: Inflection points from first derivative function

content.question: The first derivative of the function f is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@45BA@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. How many points of inflection does the graph of f have on the interval 0 < x < 2π ?

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
